Articles.Content:
I have had KSP for about a year now but stopped playing it just before 1.00 before I started playing again I was wondering what was new and if anything changed.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-02T11:59:40Z" title="08/02/2015 11:59  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 2, 2015</time> by jackboy900**

[http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Version_history](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Version_history)

Big things for 1.0 in terms of gameplay:

- Completely different aerodynamic model, you need to learn to fly/design rockets anew

- Reentry heat is a real thing now, need to do it with care (and consider putting heat shields on)

- Resource mining

Lots of little things, but those are the really big game-impacting ones.

> 
> [http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Version_history](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Version_history)
> Big things for 1.0 in terms of gameplay:
>

> 
> - Reentry heat is a real thing now, need to do it with care (and consider putting heat shields on)
> 
> - Resource mining
> 
> Lots of little things, but those are the really big game-impacting ones.

Do you know where I could get some tutorials for stuff like the heat, areo, kerbal leveling, new editor, ect. And is the aero similar to FAR?

Tutorials can be found in the Tutorials subforum ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) Especially the pinned thread "The Drawing Board" there.

And yes, stock is fairly close to FAR now (but FAR still exists).

> 
> Do you know where I could get some tutorials for stuff like the heat, areo, kerbal leveling, new editor, ect. And is the aero similar to FAR?

Heat, aero tutorial: Check out tutorial section of the forum and there should be already a bunch.

Leveling and editor: Not too much changed. engineer/scientist level becomes more important for drilling/lab, but that's about it

Aero: Closer but not close, but not as dumb as before where drag is proportional to mass. At least adding nosecones will improve things now.
The Isp of all the engines is lower in 1.0.x and nukes only use liquid fuel rather than liquid fuel and oxidizer.
